tags.name: Resources
tags.description: Subscription and Data plane Resources operations

requestBody.description: Request payload to register a k8s data plane

201.description: Response object after registering a k8s data plane

requestBody.description: Request payload to register a control-tower data plane

201.description: Response object after registering a control-tower data plane

get.description: Get data planes in a subscription

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Data planes can be filtered based on name and type(k8s/control-tower) parameters. Ex: /cp/api/v1/data-planes?$filter=type.eq.k8s&$filter=name.eq.k8sdp1

parameters.name: order-by
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to sort the data based on the Data Plane name. Ex: /cp/api/v1/data-planes?order-by=name

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: This parameter can be used to sort the data either in ascending (asc) or descending (desc) order. 'order-by' parameter must be passed with 'order' parameter. Ex: /cp/api/v1/data-planes?order-by=name&order=asc

parameters.name: $page
parameters.description: This denotes the page number of the response. 'page' parameter must be passed with 'limit' parameter. Ex: /cp/api/v1/data-planes?$page=1&$limit=10

parameters.name: $limit
parameters.description: This denotes number of records fetched per call. 'limit' parameter must be passed with 'page' parameter. Ex: /cp/api/v1/data-planes?$page=1&$limit=10

commands.description: Helm commands to be used for Namespace creation, Service Account creation and Cluster registration

commands.cmd: helm repo add my-repo-alias https://www.helm-repo-url.com/repository-name --username username --password password && helm repo update my-repo-alias
commands.description: helm command to authenticate helm repo

commands.cmd:
echo -e 'kubectl apply -f - <<EOF
apiVersion: v1
kind: Namespace
metadata:
  name: my-namespace
  labels:
    platform.tibco.com/dataplane-id: cv7rv5jddha1gdi2162g
EOF' | bash

helm upgrade --install -n my-namespace dp-configure-namespace my-repo-alias/dp-configure-namespace --version 1.5.3  --set global.tibco.dataPlaneId=cv7rv5jddha1gdi2162g --set global.tibco.subscriptionId=cuq4qiqugsdfke0k7k3g --set global.tibco.primaryNamespaceName=my-namespace --set global.tibco.serviceAccount=my-service-account --set global.tibco.containerRegistry.url=https://www.registy-url.com --set global.tibco.containerRegistry.username=username --set global.tibco.containerRegistry.password=password --set global.tibco.containerRegistry.repository=repository-name --set global.tibco.enableClusterScopedPerm=true

helm upgrade --install dp-core-infrastructure -n my-namespace my-repo-alias/dp-core-infrastructure --version 1.5.4 --set global.tibco.dataPlaneId=cv7rv5jddha1gdi2162g --set global.tibco.subscriptionId=cuq4qiqugsdfke0k7k3g --set tp-tibtunnel.configure.accessKey=G9nPuU5wpJXqDrBMl5uw4G5bUmWjXwyFbpvCBMsjJLQ --set tp-tibtunnel.connect.url=https://rajt.cp1-tunnel.localhost.dataplanes.pro/sub-cuq4qiqugsdfke0k7k3g-dp-cv7rv5jddha1gdi2162g --set global.tibco.serviceAccount=my-service-account --set global.tibco.containerRegistry.url=https://www.registy-url.com --set global.tibco.containerRegistry.repository=repository-name --set global.proxy.httpProxy=http://www.http-proxy.com --set global.proxy.httpsProxy=https://www.https-proxy.com --set global.proxy.noProxy='https://www.no-proxy.com' --set global.tibco.cpCertificateSecret=my-custom-certificate --set global.logging.fluentbit.enabled=true

concreteRecipe.description: Concrete recipe generated for provisioning of capability instance

dataplaneName.description: Data plane name on which capability is provisioned

tibcoHubBaseAppUrl.description: TIBCO HUB URL on which user should get redirected from left navigation menu

path-prefix.description:
Must begin with a forward slash (/) followed by some text. example: /tibco/bw/<dataplane-id>.
The path-prefix must be unique within the dataplane cluster. It should not conflict with other capabilities in any other dataplane within the same cluster.

storage-class-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

ingress-controller-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

db-config-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

auto-discovery-enabled.description: Used to enable / disable BWCE Apps Auto discovery.

auto-discovery-config.description: Configuration is used to define label selector expression per namespace. Please refer kubernetes documentation for label selector expressions.

port.description: BW Engine port, default value is 8090

path-prefix.description:
Must begin with a forward slash (/) followed by some text. example: /tibco/flogo/<dataplane-id>.
The path-prefix must be unique within the dataplane cluster. It should not conflict with other capabilities in any other dataplane within the same cluster.

storage-class-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

ingress-controller-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

storage-class-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

ingress-controller-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

database-resource-instance-id.description: Before the capability can be provisioned you need to provide the id of one of the already configured resources or configure a new resource.

developer-hub-name.description: The name of your TIBCO Developer Hub, this will uniquely identify your TIBCO Developer Hub instance.

host-name.description: The host part of the URL on which your TIBCO Developer Hub will be made available.

ingress-class-name.description: The Ingress Class Name will point to the Ingress Controller in your Dataplane to make sure the TIBCO Developer Hub is accessible from the outside.

kubernetes-secret-object.description: The Kubernetes Secret object name that needs to exist in the Kubernetes Namespace where the Developer Hub will be installed. This object should contain all the Environment Variables (${}) specified in the Configuration YAML.

custom-config.description: You can set a custom config (Stringified YAML).

alias.description: Only special character allowed is '-'. It must start and end with an alphanumeric character. Avoid using reserved keywords

capability.description: Capability name for which the alert rule is being created

time-range.description: The time range of historical data used to evaluate the alert rule. Minimum value can be 5

operator.description: To be used in conjunction with the threshold-value to evaluate the alert rule.

rule-category.description: The application metric to be monitored. The alert rule will be triggered if the metric exceeds the threshold-value.

time-interval-for-situation-to-persist.description: The time interval for which the condition needs to persist before an alert is triggered

ems-ssl-no-verify-host.description: Do not verify EMS SSL Host. If set as false, provide ems-ssl-identity.

ems-ssl-no-verify-hostname.description: Do not verify EMS SSL Host Name. If set as false, provide ems-ssl-expected-hostname.
